ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Van Allen Probe A ECT HOPE Science Release #4 Spin Averaged Level 2 Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated InformationURL URLs as needed, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220818

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: RBSP-A Energetic Particle, Composition, and Thermal Plasma Suite (ECT) Helium Oxygen Proton Electron Electrostatic Analyzer (HOPE) Spin-Averaged Science Data. Electron ~15 to 50,000 eV, Ion ~1 to 50,000 eV Fluxes, Electrons and Ions measured in Alternate Spin Cadence
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Herb Funsten, Ruth Skoug, Reiner Friedel

PublicationInfo.Authors: Funsten, H.O., R.M. Skoug, and R. Friedel

Parameter.Name: Epoch
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch, UT

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates (ion timebase)
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad. Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file.

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates (electron timebase)
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad. Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Model magnetic field strength at magnetic equator (ion timebase)
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Model magnetic field strength at magnetic equator (electron timebase)
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Local Time
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to ion measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Local Time
Parameter.Caveats: Interpolated to electron measurement timebase from 1 min. resolution MagEphem file. Calculated with LANLGeomag library. Internal field: IGRF. External field: OP77Q.

Parameter.Name: Satellite position (GEO)
Parameter.Description: [Labels on plots] Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates(ion)
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersection of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Calculated magnetic field strength at magnetic equator(ion)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated McIlwains L parameter (Earths radii, ion)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated Roederers L* parameter (Earths radii, ion)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Local Time
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Satellite positele (GEO)
Parameter.Description: [Labels on plots] Positele of the satellite in geographic coordinates(ele)
Parameter.Caveats: Origin = Earths center of mass. X = Intersectele of Greenwich meridian and geographic equator. Z = Geographic North Pole. Y = completes a right-handed Cartesian triad

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field strength
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Equatorial magnetic field strength
Parameter.Description: Calculated magnetic field strength at magnetic equator(ele)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: McIlwains L parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated McIlwains L parameter (Earths radii, ele)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Roederers L* parameter
Parameter.Description: Calculated Roederers L* parameter (Earths radii, ele)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Adiabatic invariant (bounce)
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Local Time
Parameter.Caveats: Calculated using ONERA-DESP library Internal field: DGRF/IGRF External field: Olson and Pfitzer quiet

Parameter.Name: Sector_Collapse for Counters data
Parameter.Description: Collapse method used for a given pixel.
Parameter.Caveats: For a given pixel, the number of spin angle sectors which are collapsed on board to fit the telemetry allocation. The collapse method sums all values together, then compresses according to the following algorithm: if (sum < 16384) {return sum} else {return ((sum-16384)/64) + 16384}

Parameter.Name: Acquisition_Period
Parameter.Caveats: The length of a single ESA step acquisition

Parameter.Name: Plan
Parameter.Caveats: Which science plan was used for the acquisition. The seclected science plan determines the ESA Sweep, TOF DAC, data product selection, and data collapse method used for an acquisition. As a general rule, plans 0-7 and 15 are reserved for HOPE nominal operations, and 8-14 are reserved for burst support operations.

Parameter.Name: Plan_Step
Parameter.Caveats: Which step within a science plan was used. Each science plan consists of up to 16 steps, each of which can specify different HVPS and telemetry configuration settings.

Parameter.Name: ESA_Volt
Parameter.Caveats: Absolute values of the ESA voltage that was used for each energy step.

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ion
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch at times of ion mode measurements

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ion_DELTA
Parameter.Caveats: Half the HOPE frame time

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ele
Parameter.Caveats: Epoch at times of electron mode measurements

Parameter.Name: Epoch_Ele_DELTA
Parameter.Caveats: Half the HOPE frame time

Parameter.Name: ESA_Polarity
Parameter.Caveats: Polarity of the ESA voltage. 0 = positive (electron mode), 1 = negative (ion mode)

Parameter.Name: ESA_Sweep
Parameter.Caveats: Which of the 16 ESA Sweep ptables was used for the acquisition.

Parameter.Name: Energy_Collapsed
Parameter.Caveats: Whether or not energy collapsing was enabled for Counters (starts, stops, H+, He+, O+, e-, etc.) data. 0 = collapsed, 1 = not collapsed.

Parameter.Name: Flags_Ion
Parameter.Caveats: Flags to indicate potential issues with the ion data. Each element of this array contains the flag status for a particular concern. A flag value of zero indicates no unusual concerns of that type for that time sample. Increasing flag values indicate increasing concern. See FLAGS variable for a description of each element.

Parameter.Name: Flags_Ele
Parameter.Caveats: Flags to indicate potential issues with electron data. Each element of this array contains the flag status for a particular concern. A flag value of zero indicates no unusual concerns of that type for that time sample. Increasing flag values indicate increasing concern. See FLAGS variable for a description of each element.

Parameter.Name: FOSA
Parameter.Description: HOPE Spin averaged differential oxygen flux (as spectrogram)
Parameter.Caveats: HOPE flux as a function of energy (72), averaged across spin and all detectors. Flux from each detector is weighted by the fraction of the unit sphere it samples in one spin (9.5% 25% 31% 25% 9.5%). Note that a HOPE spin oversamples the spacecraft spin so expect a slight bias depending on the flux in the oversampled spin phase for each spin
